alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Hocking; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, FAIRFIELD, NORTH CENTRAL HOCKING AND SOUTHWESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 AM EDT... At 1215 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Baltimore, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Lancaster, Reynoldsburg, Pickerington, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake, Bremen, Millersport, Pleasantville, Hide-A-Way Hills, Fairfield Beach, Obetz, Royalton, Lithopolis, Thurston, Carroll, Rushville and West Rushville. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 109 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
